TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {36167=Educated members of Congress and the administration on the various miscellaneous tarriff bills and their effect on domestic manufacturing. Monitored various miscellaneous tarriff bills including: S. 2329, H.R. 4910, S. 2330, H.R. 4909, S. 2331, H.R. 4904, S. 2332, H.R. 4903, S. 2333, H.R. 4912, S. 2334, H.R. 4911, S. 2335, H.R. 4908, H.R. 4950, H.R. 4951, and H.R. 4952., 1019=Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 (Section 5) - All Filers Are Required to Complete This Page, 19707=Educated administration officials on energy efficiency issues specific to the automotive and heavy-duty vehicle parts supplier industry. Supported providing feasible fuel economy technologies for the full range of product offerings produced and sold in the domestic and global markets. Supported legislation (H.R. 1367, S. 734) to create a program for research, development, deployment and commercialization of advanced vehicle technologies at the Department of Energy. Supported the Alternative Fuel Vehicles and Energy Security Act (S. 1001). Monitored ethanol, biofuel legislation including: H.R. 748, H.R. 1687 and S. 187. Monitored H.R. 1380 and S. 1863, known as the NAT GAS Act. Educated members of Congress on importance of research and development funding for advanced vehicle technologies., 50140=Educated members of Congress, congressional staff, and agency staff on benefits of remanufacturing parts. Supported (H.R.1518 and S. 708) legislation that requires identification of trade enforcement priorities. Educated members of Congress and administration officials on the impact of imports of auto parts from China and U.S. exports to Korea auto parts exports on the motor vehicle parts industry. Monitored Trans-Pacific Partnership agreement regarding Japan's possible inclusion and its impact on the motor vehicle parts industry., 39796=Supported legislation (H.R. 1706, S. 1233) to provide a tax credit for accelerated development and deployment of advanced safety systems for commercial motor vehicles. Supported H.R. 942, which permanently extends and strengthens the R&D tax credit. Supported the Hybrid Truck Incentives Act (H.R. 3374 & S.1220). Educated members of Congress on suppliers positions regarding tax reform.}
